item.title: [IPL-9660] General bugs on Emails
item.description:
Introduction

Several bugs on our Emails

Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
We have bugs these bugs are fixed

1. We are sending out wrong merchant order references (merchant_orderID) with this ending "%231" (e.g. BP123456789%231). %23 is the URL encoded version of '#' so probably we are still sending the merchant reference number of the suborder (must be the main order without any hashes!)
2. We are sending out wrong order dates (##Tempfield_orderdate##). Instead of sending the captured date, when the customer has ordered, we are sending the activation date (please verify for all emails).
Should: order_date = captured date
3. We are sending out Reminder 1 emails, even though the customer has already paid (this bug does not occur all the time)
Probably, after partial cancelation, there was no status update on the debt, which should have considered already received money on this debt.

Here is a timline for a recent case. the attachements are the emails, which have sent out.

TODO:

  • fix wrong date
  • find out which emails contain the encoded hash
  • check email history
  • find out why reminder 1 emails are sent

item.title: [IPL-9303] Merchant payout after Move of Due Date
item.description:
IS:
Currently, un-assigned debt_transactions of type 6 and 7 are only assigned to a label during merchant_reimbursement process when the corresponding debt qualifies by either being in merchant state CANCEL_PENDING or REIMBURSEMENT_PENDING.

How to reproduce: The due date of a debt is moved after the merchant was paid out by two weeks into the future. When the action takes place the debt_transactions with types 6/7 are created without a label. The merchant debt status is set from REIMBURSEMENT_DONE to UNASSIGNED (0). During the next merchant_reimbursement batch run the due date is not reached again. Therefore the debt will not be set to REIMBURSEMENT_PENDING and debt_transactions of type 6/7 are not collected.

SHOULD BE:
Whenever debt_transactions of type 6 and 7 without a label reference exist, they should be assigned to a label during the next weekly merchant_reimbursement batch run.

TODO:

  • adjust merchant_reimbursement step
  • adjust merchant_invoice step ?
  • create DB regresssion tests (2-3)
  • run before/after test
item.summary: Merchant payout after Move of Due Date

comments.comment: @Stefan/Duc: pls put spec for all payment methods here and remove from other user stories.
@Stefan: please remove everything from this ticket what should not be in the next Sprint and create a seperate ticket.
@Jan/Stefan: work over this again please.

item.title: [IPL-9268] Extend merchant master data for contract termination date
item.description:
Introduction

We want to indroduce a new field "contract termination date" for the merchant master data in the Backoffice. We have to adapt the merchant_reimbursement generation process, because we must not charge the monthly fee when the contract termination date has been reached.

Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
No contract termination date is considered Consider contract termination date

a) Adjust BO configuration
1. Create a new column "mr_contract_termination_" (date without timezone) in the ipaylater_merchant.merchant table.
2. Create & display an editable "contract termination" field in the BO-Master-Data view -> see attachment.
3. Default value in this field is empty (NULL).
4. Fetch the value if existing from the BO and write it in the merchant table.
5. BO rights are the same as for the other fields of the merchant master data section.

b) Adjust merchant_reimbursement process
Adjust proc ipaylater_debt.process_merchant_reimbursement. Do not charge monthly fees if the contract termination date is exceeded (i.e. do not create an entry in table merchant_debt of type MONTHLY_FEE.

Note: BO-Text: Vertragsende (german); contract termination (english)

TODO:

  • provide field with datepicker in BO
  • extend table ipaylater_merchant.merchant
  • implement save/load/display functionality
  • adjust merchant_reimbursement process
item.summary: Extend merchant master data for contract termination date

Old description:

das Datum des Ende des Vertrages eingetragen werden kann.
Ist dies erfolgt soll weiterhin bei Erreichung des Datums die
Monatsgebühr nicht mehr berechnet werden.
Beispiel: Händler kündigt zum 30.01.2013.
Neue Zeile im BO : Vertragsende: 30.01.2013
Hier darf demnach ab 01.02.2013 die Monatsgebühr nicht mehr berechnet
werden.
Gruß
Anja

all the story is ready to testing

item.title: [IPL-9127] Real Factoring: Inkasso Handling
item.description:
Introduction

Factoring debts must be flagged after 180 days in inkasso with a special factor status. Furthermore we have to distinguish between factoring and non-factoring debts, when exporting csv-files to our inkasso partners.

Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
The status for the inkasso reports & exports don't differ between factoring and non-factoring debts Debts should differ between factoring and non-factoring debts for inkasso purposes

1. We have to provide a new status in the ipaylater_debt.debt_status_factor table in order to ensure a proper reporting. We also have to adjust the process for updating these status.
The inkasso submission is handled just as for orders with normal Invoice. The only difference is, that if the order was not paid in inkasso 180 days after the submission (i.e. the customer status is still INKASSO_PENDING after 180 days); then factor-status will be set to "FACTOR_BILLPAY", in order that these orders can be identified in the reports.

2. We have to provide the factoring flag (d_is_real_factoring), when it comes to generating the csv-files for our inkasso partners
We have to extend all tables belonging to the inkasso process by the factoring flag (<TABLE_PREFIX>_is_factoring, type boolean): ipaylater_inkasso.inkasso_debt, ipaylater_inkasso.new_debts_out_csv, ipaylater_inkasso.updated_debts_out_csv.

Moreover the stored procedures that populate the tables or retrieve data must be adjusted: ipaylater_inkasso.process_new_inkasso_debt, ipaylater_inkasso.get_new_debt_csv, ipaylater_inkasso.generate_new_debt_csv, ipaylater_inkasso.get_updated_debt_csv

3. Export csv-file to inkasso-partner
As we have clarified with our inkasso partners, it's important to them to distinguish between debts which belongs to Billpay and debts which belongs to BVW.

Important: All debts which have the factoring flag have to be saved in a separate csv-file. (don't export the flag itself to the csv-file)

CSV file generation:
Debts are grouped in CSV files for inkasso partners according to their portal/country/curreny/PM combination. The assignment from portal/count/curreny/PM combination to a specific inkasso partner can be done in the Backoffice.

The BO configuration will not be extended by the "factoring" dimension. Instead will create potentially two files for each inkasso partner: one containing non-factoring debts and one containing factoring debts.

201301310531_daily_new_KSP.csv
201301310531_daily_updates_KSP.csv
NEW: 201301310531_daily_new_KSP_FACTOR.csv
NEW: 201301310531_daily_updates_KSP_FACTOR.csv

TODO
  • provide new factor status FACTOR_BILLPAY
  • create a cronjob to adjust the factor status after 180 days in inkasso
  • check if new status is visible in the debt_report
  • adjust methods to generate (new) csv-file
  • test csv-files carefully

comments.comment: TO BE CLARIFIED: KSP must receive the information which debt is an factoring debt and which not.

"ndoc_factoring?" (boolean)
this flag should not appear in the outgoing file.
csv-file 2: normal invoice (KSP) and direct debit

Concerning Ancas code:
Invoice: /*11*/l_debt_dunning_fee: dunning fee_1 plus dunning fee_2
           /*12*/l_debt_cancellation_fee: 0

Direct debit: /*11*/l_debt_dunning_fee: dunning fee_1
                   /*12*/l_debt_cancellation_fee: dunning fee_2

item.title: [IPL-9098] Extend merchant order overview in the BO and csv-export
item.description:
Introduction

The merchant should be able to see easily which oders are already paid out and which not. Furthermore we want the merchant easily to see what amount is already paid out.

Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
Merchant doesn't see which debts are already paid out Merchants can see in the csv-export file which debts are already paid out

The merchant should be able to see easily which debts are already paid out and which not; therefore we have to adapt the csv-export-file (when the the export button is clicked) in the "Order-View" in the Backoffice.

1) We add 2 columns to the CSV file: "disbursementStatus" and "disbursementAmount".

"disbursementStatus" can have one of the following values:
a) NOT_DISBURSED
b) PARTLY_DISBURSED
c) FULLY_DISBURSED

In order to calculate the disbursement amount we sum over the debt_transaction table for the corresponding main_order line. The values for "disbursementStatus" and "disbursementAmount" are calculated according to the following query:

SELECT *, CASE 
	-(select COALESCE(sum(dt_amount),0) FROM ipaylater_debt.debt_transaction WHERE dt_main_order_id = co_id AND dt_transaction_type in (3,6) AND dt_transaction_batch IS NOT NULL) 
	WHEN co_order_total_worth THEN 'FULLY_DISBURSED'
	WHEN 0 THEN 'NOT_DISBURSED' 
	ELSE 'PARTLY_DISBURSED' END as DISBURESMENT_STATUS,
	-(select COALESCE(sum(dt_amount),0) FROM ipaylater_debt.debt_transaction WHERE dt_main_order_id = co_id AND dt_transaction_type in (3,6) AND dt_transaction_batch IS NOT NULL) AS DISBURSEMENT_AMT
FROM ipaylater_customer.customer_order
WHERE co_suborder_id = 0 and co_merchant_portal_id = 1
AND co_created >= current_date - '2 month'::interval AND co_created <= current_date

Attention! According to our evaluations this will slow down the query execution by factor 2. After the implementation is done it must be verified that this value is not exceeded.

Note Only display the 2 columns in the orders export, not in the request export.

2) Restriction of the date range to 2 month
In order to restrict the load on our database we restrict the date range to maximum 2 month (provided as global option) for orders and request CSV downloads. When the date_to - date_from > '2 month" display an error message and don't generate the report.

TODO
  • check if maxmimum date range is not exceeded
  • think about how to display the "range exceeded" info to the user
  • implement calculation logic according to sample query above
  • export new values to csv-file, when button is clicked
  • the allowed date range should be provided as global option
item.summary: Extend merchant order overview in the BO and csv-export

comments.comment: bitte noch eine zusätzliche spalte hinzufügen, in der das Datum steht wann die Bestellung lt Händlerabrechnung abgerechnet worden ist.

Old description:

To add the date could be confusing for the merchant, because we could use different dates for not_disbursed debts.
Extension of debt_status_merchant table must be discussed in the planning meeting.

1) For performance reason we must restrict the available date range for the report. My suggestion would be to 2 month. Must be discussed
2) Displaying the value in the data grid out of the box will increase the load heavily and slow down the loading. This is also for reasons of missing space not a good idea.
3) There is a conceptual problem with this: the "orders" tab shows main orders (not suborders and not debts). The reimbursement status is debt based. Two possible solutions:
a) duplicate rows in the csv file: one per debt with respective disbursement status
b) Display aggreate disbursement status: NOT_DISBURSED, PARTIALLY_DISBURSED, FULLY_DISBURSED

item.title: [IPL-8454] Change salutation for all letters sent via lettershop
item.description:
Introduction

Status Quo: Sehr geehrte(r)[salutation][lastName]

Should-Be:
Use the right formal correspondence in every german (language) ums-template, according to whether it's a female or male person?

Description

Female

Result: Sehr geehrte Frau [lastName]

Male

Result = Sehr geehrter Herr [lastName]

Introduce condition in velocity. If gender is male, use "Herr" else "Frau".

Note/Additional Information

Note = For other languages we have to implement new conditions.
Note 2= Don't copy the condition from the description, because i didn't use the right separator.
item.summary: Change salutation for all letters sent via lettershop

item.title: [IPL-8388] Extend DueDate shift for smaller Merchants via Backoffice and all payment methods
item.description:
Introduction

We have to implement/extent our rights management for moving due date for all payment methods (except direct debit) and countries, in order to save a lot of time in the CC department. We should allow all merchant (under certain conditions) to move due dates via BO and API.

Description
As-Is-Status Should-Be-Status
Only Key-Accounts can move due dates (API) All merchants, which are allowed can move due dates (BO & API)

Every Merchant should move due dates via Backoffice, if we allow him to do so.

Overview Rights-Management (Admin,CC and Merchant)

Merchants-Rights for offset (Allow move due date in days)should be adjustable in the Backoffice portal based (all payment methods/country/currency combinations) for admin and CC. (except direct debit)

Merchants-Rights for allow to move due after due date expired, should be adjustable in the Backoffice payment methods/country/currency - wise for admin and CC. (except direct debit)

The image below just illustrate invoice, please also consider invoice B2B. Note: For TC it's already existing.

So we have two options to allow move due date.

1. Option: Allow move in days (if it's "0", it's not allowed for this merchant)
We already have a field that is for now exclusivly used to move due date via API (mrc_duedate_extension). This field will after the implementation still be used to allow move due date via API & BO (for INV- B2C, B2B, TC). If the logged-in user is a merchant the due due date can only be extened by the given value.

2. Option: Allow move after due date of debt. (Or alternative Text: Allow move due date extension after debt due date?) (Note: if it's "0" days in option 1, this option 2 is obsolete)
Create a field in BO (for INV- B2C, B2B) with label "Allow move due date extension after debt due date?" matching existing column "mrcp_move_due_date_after_first_installment_enabled" that first should be renamed to mrcp_move_due_date_conditioned_allowed (boolean, default false) and make it editable via BO.
If this flag is enabled and the logged-in user is a merchant, consider the rules for displaying the button according to the yellow box (see image).

Important! The button for moving the due date is only available under the conditions given (see image) + if the logged-in user is a merchant and mrc_duedate_bo_extension is > 0.

Note/Additional Information
  • For TC/CHE move due date is not yet implemented. This will be implemented in IPL-8374. For the current user story we will act as if it was already implemented (i.e. we also show the button when the conditions match and return in error if the button is pressed.
  • the logic for moving due dates before and after the due date is reached is already implemented (only exception is TC/CHE)
  • The "allow moving after due date debt" option allows to move the due date until different points in time. The logic is depending on payment method (see image for details)
TODO
  • rename all <prefix>_move_due_date_after_first_installment_enabled columns to <prefix>_move_due_date_conditioned_allowed
  • add new BO checkbox fields (for INV- B2B, B2C) and associate them to existing renamed column mrcp_move_due_date_conditioned_allowed
  • show move button according to the rules stated above
  • implement rights management. consider different rules for ADMIN/CC and merchant.
  • update wiki rights table
item.summary: Extend DueDate shift for smaller Merchants via Backoffice and all payment methods

item.title: [IPL-4819] web.xml distributable in backoffice
item.description:
Add <distributable /> to web.xml to make backoffice session-failover

make sure, that all session-objects are serializeable.

After clarification with Daniel:
Problem of users logging out from BO doesn't have to be connected to session redistribution. There are probably at least 2 or 3 different problems with logging out:
1. User gets logout before 60m of idle time - this is not necessary connected to the load balancing since according to datacenter logs the witch is done rarely [eg. few times a day] /can be connected to spring security/
2. User sees login page but is actually not loggedout, so when going directly to different page in BO user doesn't have to log in again
3. User sees login page in popup of BO [probably connected to pt.2]

http://tomcat.apache.org/tomcat-6.0-doc/cluster-howto.html
http://wiki.metawerx.net/wiki/Web.xml.Distributable
http://wiki.metawerx.net/wiki/ApplicationLoadBalancing
http://wiki.metawerx.net/wiki/SessionReplicator

comments.comment:
since 2 days, user start really complaining about logouts caused by Loadbalancer switches

rise priority to test & configure this distributable / session replication topic

To be registered here,
Daniel will make the necessary changes in the server configuration (server.xml) and handle the testing in the new release.
Now it is for you to configure.
@Daniel; sind wir hier soweit? Morgen Nacht ist Release, da sollten wir das rausschieben.

session replication auf dem testsytem (test-admin) configuriert. Switch geht ohne logout.

TODO:
* rausfinden, warum der LB ca. 30sec zum switch braucht. Solange liefert der apache 503 aus ...

Unser xtc-Plugin muss getestet werden ob Ratenkauf AT richtig angezeigt wird und falls nötig müssen Anpassungen vorgenommen werden.

Erste Händler:
www.waterdream-wasserbetten.de

comments.comment: Transactioncredit implemented for AT and CH

item.title: [IPL-9695] Remove minimum restriction for due date shift via BO
item.description:
IS:
Currently the due date can be moved via BO for minimum 7 days. This is enforced by a the date picker not offering days 1-6 (see screenshot - current due date for the displayed order is 23-02-2013).

SHOULD BE:
remove this restriction. Due date shift by one day should also be possible.

Note works already for TC.
item.summary: Remove minimum restriction for due date shift via BO

item.title: [IPL-9687] Allow enabling/disabling of partial activation via Backoffice
item.description:
IS:
Enabling partial activation for a portal is only possible via database. Afterwards the applications must be restarted in order for the caches to refresh. The PA flag is stored portal based (not country/currency specific).

SHOULD BE:
Provide Backoffice configuration option (the boolean flag is stored in merchant_configuration::mrc_partial_activation_enabled). Refresh caches after value is changed in the BO.

TODO:

  • reuse the existing spreading for invalidatiing the portal based config settings
  • provide BO configuration
  • check if PA flag is already reloaded
item.summary: Allow enabling/disabling of partial activation via Backoffice

item.title: [IPL-9686] Send spread message when amount for deviating shipping address is changed
item.description:
IS:
The portal-based amount up to which we allow a deviating shipping address in the preauth request is cached in the merchant service nodes. When the amount is changed in the Backoffice the cache is not invalidated. Thus the old value remains in the cache which leads to undefined behaviour when activating an order.

SHOULD BE:
When the value is changed in the BO caches should be invalidated portal-wise (copy&paste from the portalPaymentconfig example). Therefore send a spread message and create or reuse an existing message handler.

TODO

  • implement spreading for country/curreny specific portal settings.
item.summary: Send spread message when amount for deviating shipping address is changed

comments.comment: Adding the code below to invalidate the Localized portal configuration adds +-30ms to the method MerchantCredentialHandler: cacheLog.debug("Localized Portal configurations reloaded for portal id = "+portalId); ehCacheService.invalidateCacheRegion("localizedPortalConfigurations"); Map<Integer, List<LocalizedPortalConfigView>> c = ehCacheService.getAllLocalizedPortalConfigurations(); So no considerable overhead is added with this change

New message ReloadMerchantPortalConfigCacheMessage.java and respective handler were created ReloadMerchantPortalConfigHandler.java were created and MerchantOptionsActionBean adjusted to send this message when saving new portal configuration.

The new handler invalidates caches portalConfigurations, localizedPortalConfigurations and merchantCredentials.

item.description:
The high low algorithm of hibernate inserted some load queue rows to the debt transaction load queue.
This is a problem for reporting.
item.summary: Load Queue processing, MAX-LOW algorithm bug

comments.comment: doublicate to IPL-9797

item.title: [IPL-9797] Fix Broken dtlq_id in debt_transaction_load_queue
item.description:
A bug in caused very high tdlq_id's which were not created by the database sequence.

At some point in the future the sequence will create an already existing id and the import will break. in order to fix that a temp table has to be created and the sequence need to create new ids for the old very high ones.

after that the temp table must be used to update the following tables with the newly created id:

debt_transaction_history
debt_transaction_load_queue
debt_transaction
debt_transaction_log
transaction_load_queue_performance

before updating debt_transaction the trigger has to be deactivated!!!! otherwise incorrect log entries will be created

Query to identify the high id's:

Select *
From ipaylater_debt.debt_transaction_history
order by dth_id desc
limit 10000

comments.comment: its known, that this is caused by mt940 java parser and hibernate sequenz
fixing scrpt

item.title: [IPL-9703] Dunning fees are canceled after Move Due Date for Invoice AUT/CHE/DEU
item.description:
This will be fixed in a User Story https://jira.billpay.intern/browse/IPL-9873

When CC moves the due date of an invoice order, the status jumps to created and the dunning fees are canceled.
We had this bug a few times already.

Dunnings fees should not be canceled unless the respective checkbox is marked.

GERMAN
Am 01.02.2013 12:01, schrieb Holger Janiczek:
> Falls machbar, soll sich der Kundenstatus bei der ZZ Verschiebung nicht verändern.
> Der springt doch über Nacht nach jeder ZZ-Verschibung auf created um und löscht erst einmal die Mahngebühren.
>
> Mahngebühren dürfen nur storniert werden, wenn ausdrücklich ein Häkchen gesetzt wurde.
>
> Oder war dieses Thema in der Zwischenzeit gefixt?
>
> Gruß
> Holger

ENGLISCH
On 01.02.2013 12:01, Holger Janiczek wrote:
> If possible, the status should not change, after a move due date.
> during the nightly batch-run the status is set to created and the dunning fees are cancelec.
>
> Dunning fees should not be canceled unless, the checkbox is checked.
>
> blablabla
>
> Gruß
> Holger
item.summary: Dunning fees are canceled after Move Due Date for Invoice AUT/CHE/DEU

comments.comment: The dunning fees are removed only if the checkbox are selected. If the date is not moved far enough in the future the debt will qualify again for DUNNING 1 or DUNNING 2 during the night.
This will be fixed in a User Story https://jira.billpay.intern/browse/IPL-9873

item.title: [IPL-9377] Rücküberweisungen werden an falsche Forderungen gehängt
item.description:
Hallo,
1. die Rücklastschrift/Rücküberweisung von der Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=462176
gehört zur Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=3816869
2. die Rücklastschrift/Rücküberweisung von der Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=680353
gehört zur Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=4098611
3. die Rücklastschrift/Rücküberweisung von der Forderung;
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=83101
gehört zur Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=3173279
Bitte schaut euch das mal genauer an, das sieht für mich aus wie ein Bug.
Danke und Gruß
item.summary: Rücküberweisungen werden an falsche Forderungen gehängt

comments.comment: evtl. schon einmal früher aufgetreten

weiterer Fall:

die Rücklastschrift von Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=90325

gehört zur Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=2721301

weiterer Fall:

die Rücklastschirft/Rücküberweisung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=94354

gehört zur Fordeurng:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=2495321
@Maik: bei den Fällen wurden den "Rücküberweisungen" an die falsche Forderung gehängt. Das hat nichts mit "Rücklastschriften" zu tun -> Titel geändert

Weiterer Fall:
Rücküberweisung von:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=870913
gehört zur Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=4369614

The debts to which the customer reimbursements belong are all with TC. The actor is in all cases SYSTEM. The amounts of the reimbursements are not reasonable. We only do immediate auto reimbursement for TC when a PC event happened. This was at least for some of the affected orders not the case.

The orders to which the worng CRs are attached are all very old.

-> strange, reason is not clear for now.

First guess: the CRs don't belong to each of the debts.

Checked order_modification for 2013-01-09 09:57:07.222136 (this is where the CR for https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=462176 was created -> No events present that could lead to an immediate auto reimbursement. The time suggests that it was not a nightly auto reimbursement.

Checked debt_log around the creation time of CR entries -> same result, no reasonable events logged

Same result for subdebt_log

Load queue was not running.

weiteres Beispiel.
Die Rücküberweisung von Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=280251
gehört zur Forderung:
https://admin.billpay.de/OrderDetail.action?orderId=3730951

Bitte fixen

item.title: [IPL-9780] (IPL-8388) Create Tests
item.description:
Investigate best way to create following test cases.
If decided test it manually.

TC CHE negative (not allowed) test

TC DE positive.

Customer Care:

  • Not Inkasso Pending, positive
  • Inkasso Pending, negative

Merchant:
TC DEU

  • Before 1st Installment due date, positive
    With defined Offset

Invoice DEU

  • Before due date reached, positive
    With defined Offset

comments.comment:
proposed test cases (if posible implemented on the test framework otherwise considered for manually testing):
TC CHE, ADMIN - not allowed yet

TC AUT
- for CC:
- if INKASSO_CLOSED - false
- before INKASSO_CLOSED - true

- for MERCHANTS
- before first rate due date - true
- between due date first rate and due date second rate, allowed on portal settings (move in days > 0 and the corresponding checkbox checked) - true
- between due date first rate and due date second rate, NOT allowed on portal settings (move in days = 0 or the corresponding checkbox NOT checked) - false
- after due date second rate - false

INVOICE DEU
- for CC
- if INKASSO_CLOSED - false
- before INKASSO_CLOSED - true

- for MERCHANTS
- before debt due date - true
- after debt due date and before INKASSO PENDING, allowed on portal settings (move in days > 0 and the corresponding checkbox checked) - true
- after debt due date and before INKASSO PENDING, NOT allowed on portal settings (move in days = 0 or the corresponding checkbox NOT checked) - false
- if INKASSO PENDING - false

comments.comment:
=== DB CHANGES ======================
CHANGED
ipaylater_inkasso.process_updated_debts_for_portal
ipaylater_inkasso.process_new_inkasso_debt
- to update the ipaylater_inkasso.inkasso_debt table

ipaylater_inkasso.inkasso_outfile_result - contains both file name and file content
ipaylater_inkasso.inkasso_outfile_list_result - contains a list of ipaylater_inkasso.inkasso_outfile_result

ipaylater_inkasso.generate_new_debt_csv

- returns an inkasso_outfile_list_result

ipaylater_inkasso.get_inkasso_file_name - since the file name is returned with the content

    GenerateNewDebtCsvProc
    GenerateUpdatedDebtCsvProc

InkassoOutFileResultView

comments.comment:
de.billpay.test.loadqueue.purpose.matching.faulty.noslash
de.billpay.test.loadqueue.purpose.matching.faulty.noslash.space
de.billpay.test.loadqueue.purpose.matching.faulty.wrongslash

/api-integration-test/src/test/resources/de/billpay/test/loadqueue/invoice/purpose_variations

The tests are still on ignore (see LoadQueuePurposeMatchingFaultyTest) since the levenshtein function it is not found if the process_debt_transaction_load_queue(1000) is called from the tests.

If the test is used to generate the test data and process_debt_transaction_load_queue(1000) is called from pgadmin there is no complain about the levenshtein function.

TODO: investigate and find a solution when the time will allow us.

The tests are not passing if you remove the @Ignore
Also a refactoring must be made, as I did for the failing cases, into LoadQueuePurposeMatchingFaultyTest.
I described In the class LoadQueuePurposeMatchingSuccessTest how to do it.

The purpose is to have only two test clases one for failing cases (LoadQueuePurposeMatchingFaultyTest) and one for the successfull ones (LoadQueuePurposeMatchingSuccessTest)

we will see more about this tomorrow :)
